translated: Among these eight causes and conditions, the first one serves as the direct cause and condition for the section on establishing the meaning. The next two serve as the direct cause and condition for the section on explanation. The next four serve as the direct cause and condition for the section on the practice of faith. The last one serves as the direct cause and condition for the section on encouraging practice and benefits.
Within the first cause and condition, there are four approaches. Within the next seven causes and conditions, each is equipped with three approaches.
What are the four?

First, the gate of the emergence of the teaching of transformation; second, the gate of the scope of the beings to be transformed; third, the gate of skillful activity in emerging; fourth, the gate of dispelling disputes and slander.
What are the three?
Namely, the first three gates.
Now, I will raise the characteristics and explain them separately in order.

As for the general characteristics of causes and conditions, it generally raises the gate of the emergence of the teaching of transformation, namely, it serves as the right cause and condition for the eight fundamental general principles, therefore it is called causes and conditions, and it serves as the right cause and condition for the twenty-four kinds of separate characteristics, therefore it is called the characteristics of causes and conditions.
The thirty-two kinds of general and separate characteristics will be clearly explained in the chapter on establishing the meaning.

As for the beings, it generally raises the gate of the scope of the beings to be transformed, namely, it includes the ten billion eighty-eight thousand kinds of beings in the heterodox aggregate, the thirty kinds of beings in the indeterminate aggregate, and the one hundred twenty kinds of beings in the correct aggregate.
To part from all suffering and attain ultimate bliss generally raises the skillful means of undertaking activities, referring to taking the three groups as objects.

Proclaiming and revealing the essential teachings is for the sake of causing all immeasurable sentient beings to part from the suffering of arising and ceasing impermanence and to obtain the bliss of the fundamental general characteristics.
Not seeking worldly fame, profit, and respect generally raises the gate of dispelling disputes and slander, referring to the doubts of ignorant beings:

AÅ›vaghoá¹£a Bodhisattva is dwelling in the stage of Immovable and has not yet reached the stage of Dharma Cloud, yet takes the bodhisattvas of the upper stages as his objects of transformation. This only reveals his own superiority and seeks fame, profit, and so forth, with empty words lacking true meaning.
How can a bodhisattva of a lower stage be able to teach and transform a bodhisattva of a higher stage?
Therefore, in order to dispel such doubts of disbelief, AÅ›vaghoá¹£a himself explains:

I have long ago completed perfect enlightenment and have been assisting in teaching and transforming to benefit sentient beings. In order to fulfill my original vow, I temporarily demonstrate the stages of cultivation, not because I wish to seek fame, profit, etc. I speak like this.
The first cause and condition has already been explained.

The second cause and condition states explaining the fundamental meaning of the TathÄgata. This generally raises the gate of the arising of the teaching of the one who transforms, namely, this cause and condition is able to reveal the correct meaning and counteract mistaken attachments, thus creating the correct cause and conditions, therefore it is called the fundamental meaning of the TathÄgata.
Why is it so?

There is not a single TathÄgata in the ten directions and three times who has not attained perfect enlightenment through the fundamental one mind, the two gates, and the seven kinds of countermeasures.

Causing sentient beings generally raises the gate of the scope of the transformed sentient beings, namely, subsuming the ten billion, eighty-four thousand kinds of sentient beings in the class of fixed error.

Because the correct understanding is not erroneous generally raises the skillful means of the arising and functioning of the teaching. It means that taking the sentient beings of the heterodox samÄdhi and madness as the object, proclaiming, expounding, and revealing the correct profound Dharma that counteracts heterodox attachments, it correctly eliminates the erroneous understandings of the Ganges sands, destroys the rebellious views of the dust motes, cuts off the hindrances of disbelief and icchantika, and causes them to enter the great path of the ten faiths.
The second cause and condition has already been explained.

The third cause and condition is to distinguish the characteristics of the path of progress and make it the correct cause and condition. This is called the gate of the arising of the teaching of transformation. It refers to the three kinds of generating the mind.

Sentient beings with accomplished wholesome roots generally raises the gate of the scope of the transformed sentient beings. It means including the sentient beings of the upper level of the ten faiths, the three levels of the ten abodes, the three levels of the ten practices, the three levels of the ten dedications, and the three levels of the ten grounds.

Because they are able to uphold the faith that does not regress in the MahÄyÄna Dharma generally raises the skillful means gate of the activity of arising, which means that taking the two accumulations of sentient beings as the object, for the three kinds of those who give rise to the aspiration for enlightenment, in order to cause them to transcend their own stage and attain the superior, [the Buddha] proclaims and reveals.
The third cause and condition has already been explained.

The fourth cause and condition is the correct cause and condition for the four kinds of faith and four kinds of practice in the chapter on cultivating faith and understanding, which is called the gate of the arising of the teaching of the means of conversion.

Sentient beings with meager wholesome roots generally raises the gate of the scope of the sentient beings to be converted, which means that it includes the middling sentient beings in the first five states of mind before the stage of the ten faiths.
Because they have already attained the first five, they are not completely without wholesome roots, and are called meager.
Because they have not yet attained the latter five, they are unable to be complete, and are not called accomplished.

In order to cultivate faith and understanding generally raises the skillful means gate of the activity of arising, which means that it is able to cause the accomplishment of the latter five kinds of faith and understanding.
The fourth cause and condition has already been explained.
The fifth cause and condition is the end of the chapter on the method of advancing in the practice of faith.

Furthermore, even if a person practices faith, in order to avoid obstacles and increase wholesome roots, it becomes the correct cause and condition. This is called the method of the appearance of the teaching of transformation.
Here, sentient beings include those of the initial stage of the ten stages of faith, the lowest level of beings. This is called the method of the scope of the transformed beings.

Eliminating the obstacles of evil karma and so on generally raises the skillful method of the appearance of karma, referring to the expedient means of showing worship, repentance, and so on, in order to eliminate the ocean of various karmic obstacles.
The fifth cause and condition has already been explained.

The sixth cause and condition says cultivating calming and contemplation, generally raising the method of the appearance of the teaching of transformation, referring to becoming the correct cause and condition for the method of cultivating calming and contemplation in the practice of faith.

Ordinary beings and the two vehicles generally refers to the scope of sentient beings to be converted, meaning those of the two lower grades of the two minds in the ten stages of faith, and all those of the two vehicles who are included in the category of those of fixed evil.

Curing the faults of the mind generally refers to the skillful means of the arising of activity, meaning that the two wheels are used together to cure the faults of the views and attachments of ordinary beings and the two vehicles.
The sixth cause and condition has already been explained.
The seventh cause and condition is the end of the chapter on the practice of faith.

Next, in order for sentient beings who are beginners in this teaching to ultimately attain birth and abide in the stage of right certainty, it serves as the correct cause and condition. This is called the gate of the arising of the teaching of the converter.

Here, sentient beings refer to those of the four lower grades of the first four minds in the ten stages of faith, meaning those who are unable to make further progress, because they are extremely fearful of the world of faith in which they abide. This is called the gate of the scope of the sentient beings to be converted.

Because they will definitely not regress in their faith generally raises the skillful means of the arising and activity of the teaching, meaning that by the power of excellent conditions they are established in the stage of definite goodness.
The seventh cause and condition has already been explained.

The eighth cause and condition is in order to encourage the cultivation of benefits and make it a proper cause and condition, which is called the gate of the arising of the teaching of the means of transformation.
